001package io.github.ai4ci.config;
002
003import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
004import java.lang.annotation.Inherited;
005import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
006import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
007import java.lang.annotation.Target;
008
009import io.github.ai4ci.util.Conversions;
010
011/**
012 * Annotation used to declare the intended scaling behaviour for a configuration
013 * parameter accessor.
014 *
015 * <p>
016 * Parameters annotated with {@code @Scale} indicate how a base value should be
017 * transformed when an adjustment factor is applied. This is used by the
018 * configuration execution code (for example in
019 * {@code io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.DemographicAdjustment} and the
020 * generated {@code PartialDemographicAdjustment} classes) to interpret
021 * adjustment values consistently.
022 * </p>
023 *
024 * <p>
025 * The annotation can express three scaling strategies via the
026 * {@link Scale.ScaleType} enum: ODDS, FACTOR and POWER (see
027 * {@link ScaleType#scale(double,double,ScaleType)} for behaviour and formulae).
028 * In common usage ODDS is appropriate when the parameter is a probability and
029 * the adjustment should act on odds; FACTOR multiplies a numeric baseline;
030 * POWER raises the baseline to a power. The implementation for the odds scaling
031 * delegates to
032 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.util.Conversions#scaleProbabilityByOR(double,double)}.
033 * </p>
034 *
035 * @author Rob Challen
036 */
037@Inherited
038@Target(ElementType.METHOD)
039@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
040public @interface Scale {
041        /**
042         * The available scaling strategies.
043         */
044        enum ScaleType {
045                /**
046                 * Scale probabilities on the odds scale. Use this for parameters that
047                 * represent probabilities so that multipliers act on odds rather than on
048                 * raw probabilities. The computation performed by
049                 * {@link ScaleType#scale(double,double,ScaleType)} delegates to
050                 * {@link Conversions#scaleProbabilityByOR(double,double)}.
051                 *
052                 * <p>
053                 * Formula (probability p, factor f):
054                 * </p>
055                 * \[ p' = \frac{f\cdot \dfrac{p}{1-p}}{1 + f\cdot \dfrac{p}{1-p}} \]
056                 */
057                ODDS,
058
059                /**
060                 * Multiply the base value by a factor. Suitable for rates or other
061                 * continuous measures where a multiplicative change is required.
062                 *
063                 * <p>
064                 * Formula (base b, factor f):
065                 * </p>
066                 * \[ b' = b \times f \]
067                 */
068                FACTOR,
069
070                /**
071                 * Raise the base value to the given power. Useful for elastic or
072                 * non-linear transformations.
073                 *
074                 * <p>
075                 * Formula (base b, exponent f):
076                 * </p>
077                 * \[ b' = b^{f} \]
078                 */
079                POWER;
080
081                /**
082                 * Apply the selected scaling to a numeric base value.
083                 *
084                 * <p>
085                 * Behaviour:
086                 * <ul>
087                 * <li>{@link #FACTOR} returns {@code base * factor}.</li>
088                 * <li>{@link #ODDS} applies odds scaling via
089                 * {@link Conversions#scaleProbabilityByOR(double,double)}.</li>
090                 * <li>{@link #POWER} returns {@code Math.pow(base, factor)}.</li>
091                 * </ul>
092                 *
093                 * @param base   the base value to be scaled
094                 * @param factor the adjustment factor or exponent
095                 * @param scale  the scaling strategy to apply
096                 * @return the scaled value
097                 */
098                public static double scale(double base, double factor, ScaleType scale) {
099                        switch (scale) {
100                        case FACTOR:
101                                return base * factor;
102                        case ODDS:
103                                return Conversions.scaleProbabilityByOR(base, factor);
104                        case POWER:
105                                return Math.pow(base, factor);
106                        }
107                        throw new RuntimeException();
108                }
109        }
110
111        /**
112         * The scaling strategy to use. Defaults to {@link ScaleType#ODDS}.
113         *
114         * @return the scale type
115         */
116        Scale.ScaleType value() default Scale.ScaleType.ODDS;
117}
